post.description:
Lightweight notification for charge point master data changes.

This notification is triggered when the charge point itself has been edited but NOT when:
- The network or hardware status have changed (use NetworkStatusNotification and HardwareStatusNotification instead)
- EVSEs of the charge point have changed (use evse.changed notification instead)

The notification only contains minimal information: notification type, charge point ID, action taken, and timestamp.
To get the full charge point details, use the charge point API endpoint with the provided ID.

parameters.name: X-Signature
parameters.description: SHA256-HMAC signature of the content using the access token

parameters.name: X-Timestamp
parameters.description: ISO-8601 format timestamp including microseconds in Zulu timezone

parameters.name: X-Tenant
parameters.description: The tenant ID the notification is associated with

chargePointId.description: The ID of the charge point that was changed

action.description:
The action that was performed:
- `created`: A new charge point was created
- `updated`: An existing charge point's master data was modified
- `deleted`: A charge point was deleted

post.description:
Lightweight notification for EVSE and connector changes.

This notification is triggered when an EVSE has been edited, including changes to its own properties or its connectors.
The notification is NOT triggered when the hardware status changes (use HardwareStatusNotification instead).

The notification only contains minimal information: notification type, EVSE ID, action taken, and timestamp.
To get the full EVSE details, use the EVSE API endpoint with the provided ID.

parameters.name: X-Signature
parameters.description: SHA256-HMAC signature of the content using the access token

parameters.name: X-Timestamp
parameters.description: ISO-8601 format timestamp including microseconds in Zulu timezone

parameters.name: X-Tenant
parameters.description: The tenant ID the notification is associated with

evseId.description: The ID of the EVSE that was changed

action.description:
The action that was performed:
- `created`: A new EVSE was created
- `updated`: An existing EVSE or its connectors were modified
- `deleted`: An EVSE was deleted

post.description:
For each action/sync-configuration, you will get one notification callback.
You will also get a notification in case the an automatic sync is done (after charge point boot). In that case there will be no requestId.

parameters.name: X-Signature
parameters.description: SHA256-HMAC signature of the content using the access token

parameters.name: X-Timestamp
parameters.description: ISO-8601 format timestamp including microseconds in Zulu timezone

parameters.name: X-Tenant
parameters.description: The tenant ID the notification is associated with

timestamp.description: When was the configuration last updated

configuration.description:
If there is no error this holds list of Charge Point's configuration properties.
In case the request was for full load or there was no request but an automatic full load, all keys will be present.
In case the request only wanted some keys, only those keys will be present.

error.description: If sync configuration failed this will hold the error message description.

timezone.description: A valid timezone in the form of Area/Location, required when `Allow Multiple Time Zones` option is turned on in the Timezone Setting.

is_always_open.description: Indicates that the location is always open for charging. If set to false, the `hours` field is required, otherwise it should be ignored.

stop_session_outside_working_hours.description: If a User has initiated a charging session during Working hours but it is already outside of the Working hours, the session will be terminated by the system. This is valid only for Users that are not included in one of the User Groups for which the Location is available 24/7.

hours.description:
The times should be considered to be in the location/tenant timezone.
If a day does not have any entries, it will be treated as closed for the whole day.

wednesday.description: Working hours interval for single day

thursday.description: Working hours interval for single day

reason.description: The reason why the session expired or has been stopped.

userId.description: In case of start action it will contain the user id if there is one. It will be null for anonumous sessions. In case of stop transaction it will always be null.

meterStart.description: Meter value in Wh when the session is started.

meterStop.description: Meter value in Wh when the session is stopped.

userId.description: The ID of the user associated with the session. Omitted for anonymous sessions.

meterStart.description: Meter value in Wh when the session is started.

meterStop.description: Meter value in Wh when the session is stopped.

startedAtTimestampLocal.description: Local timestamp when the session started (when multi-timezone is enabled).

stoppedAtTimestampLocal.description: Local timestamp when the session stopped (when multi-timezone is enabled).

energyConsumed.description: Total energy consumed during the session in Wh

reason.description: The reason why the session expired or has been stopped.

reason.description: The reason why the session expired or has been stopped.

userId.description: The id of the user that started the session

bookingId.description: The ID of the linked booking (if any)

powerKw.description: This field representing the current charging speed in kilowatts is deprecated. Use the `power.latest` property instead for charging power information.

currency.description: The ISO 4217 3-letter code of the currency

paymentMethodId.description: The ID of the payment method. Mind that this is actually a string. It can be, for example `corporate:1234` - for corporate billing, or `balance`, or `subscription` - when the session is to be paid with the user's post-paid subscription.

terminalId.description: The ID of the payment terminal when such is used.

nonBillableEnergy.description: The energy that is included as an allowance for pre-paid and post subscriptions.

idTag.description:
The idTag defines the authentication source for the session (RFID identifier or remote start identifier)
A remote start identifier has the format `*XXXXXXX` where the `XXXXXXX` is the session id padded with `0`s on the left

idTagLabel.description: Additional information about the idTag that differs depending on the type of the idTag or could be something else, related to the car or the user.

extendingSessionId.description:
When a session is finished (because connectivity was lost for a long time) and more data is received, the
additional data is stored in an extending session. If this property is set, then this is an extending session.

originalSessionId.description: ID of the session that the current session is extending.

extendedBySessionId.description: ID of the session that extends this session.

externalSessionId.description:
Deprecated: Use `idTag` field instead. This field will be removed in a future version.
Previously used for admin-started sessions, this value is now available in the `idTag` field.

source.description: In case roaming is set, the method can only be user_device or rfid_tag

rfidTagUid.description: The UID of the RFID card that created the authorization

roaming.description: In case source is roaming, this object describes the EMSP that gave the authorization

platformId.description: The roaming plarform ID that gave the authoriation

platformRoleId.description: The role that gave the authorization (the EMSP)

client.description: OCPI's contractId, or Hubjects EVCO ID

items.description: Describes a period in the session that is billed separately, for example charging@night (for time of day tariffs) or idle (for tariffs that charge separately idle time)

state.description:
The state of the period. A non exhaustive list of possible values:
  * `charging` - the vehicle was charging
  * `charging@night` - a ToD tariff was selected and the vehicle was charging during the nighttime period of the tariff
  * `charging@day` - a ToD tariff was selected and the vehicle was charging during the daytime period of the tariff
  * `idle` - a tariff with separate pricing for idle time was selected and the charging was idle in that period
  * `idle@night` - a ToD tariff was selected and the vehicle was idling during the nighttime period of the tariff
  * `idle@day` - a ToD tariff was selected and the vehicle was idling during the daytime period of the tariff
  * `charging@boosted` - Optimised dynamic pricing was applied and charging was performed with full available power
  * `charging@optimised` - Optimised dynamic pricing was applied and charging was performed with lower price and limited power during peak hours

chargingState.description: The charging state of the period.

pricingDetails.description: Optional pricing details specific to this charging period, dependent on the tariff.

chargingType.description:
Power delivery strategy used during this period.
  * `boosted` - maximum available power delivery
  * `optimised` - reduced power during peak hours for cost efficiency

dayPeriod.description:
The period of the day.
  * `day` - daytime period of the tariff
  * `night` - nighttime period of the tariff

pricingMethod.description:
The method used for calculating price in standard tariffs.
  * `duration` - pricing based on duration
  * `energy` - pricing based on energy consumption
  * `durationAndEnergy` - pricing based on both duration and energy
  * `free` - free period with no charge

price.description: Base price rate for Energy Time of Usage tariffs

markup.description: Additional percentage or fixed amount added to the base price

initialEnergyPrice.description: Starting price rate for energy-based charging

initialDurationPrice.description: Starting price rate for time-based charging

startHour.description: The start hour for the charging period

endHour.description: The end hour for the charging period

items.description: Charging period price breakdown

type.description:
* `flat` - no matter the duration or energy consumed each session would cost one and the same amount,
* `connection` - a fixed fee that is applied at the start of the charging session,
* `energy` - the cost for the consumed energy,
* `charging_time` - the cost for the duration of the session when there is ongoing charging,
* `idle_time` - the cost for the time when there is no active charging but there is an ongoing session,
* `power_levels_time` - the cost for peak and average power levels,
* `min_price` - the minimum price a session should cost, anything below that price is rounded up to the minimum price,
* `service_fee` - the cost for the mark up,
* `energy_flat_fee` - a fixed fee applied per energy component,
* `duration_flat_fee` - a fixed fee applied per duration component,
* `idle_flat_fee` - a fixed fee applied per idle component.

currency.description: 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217)

unit.description: The measure that is used for the type element.

pricePerUnit.description: The price of a single unit of the tariff element.

price.description: The `pricePerUnit` multiplied by the `quantity`.

taxPercentage.description: The tax rate percentage applied to this tariff element.

priceBreakdown.description: A breakdown of the different tariff elements that create the total amount of the charging period. Only sent when `withChargingPeriodsPriceBreakdown` is set to `true`. The priceBreakdown will be displayed only when the Billing status of the session is marked as completed.

type.description:
* `flat` - no matter the duration or energy consumed each session would cost one and the same amount,
* `connection` - a fixed fee that is applied at the start of the charging session,
* `energy` - the cost for the consumed energy,
* `charging_time` - the cost for the duration of the session when there is ongoing charging,
* `idle_time` - the cost for the time when there is no active charging but there is an ongoing session,
* `power_levels_time` - the cost for peak and average power levels,
* `min_price` - the minimum price a session should cost, anything below that price is rounded up to the minimum price,
* `service_fee` - the cost for the mark up,
* `energy_flat_fee` - a fixed fee applied per energy component,
* `duration_flat_fee` - a fixed fee applied per duration component,
* `idle_flat_fee` - a fixed fee applied per idle component.

currency.description: 3-letter currency code (ISO 4217)

unit.description: The measure that is used for the type element.

pricePerUnit.description: The price of a single unit of the tariff element.

price.description: The `pricePerUnit` multiplied by the `quantity`.

taxPercentage.description: The tax rate percentage applied to this tariff element.

unitPrice.description: The price of a single unit of the tariff element.

priceBreakdown.description: A breakdown of the different tariff elements that create the total amount of the charging session. Only sent when `session_with_price_breakdown` is set to `true`. The priceBreakdown will be displayed only when the Billing status of the session is marked as completed.

tariffSnapshotId.description: At the start of the charging session the tariff will be snapshotted and that snapshot will not be changed ever. That snapshot is used to determine the price of the charging session. This is the ID of that snapshot.

evsePhysicalReference.description: This could be either the identifier that is presented to the user, so they can identify the EVSE at the location. Or for roaming EVSEs - it is the roaming evse_id.

chargePointOperatorRoamingId.description: The roaming operator identifier (e.g., "DE*ENA", "LT*IGN") of the operator who owns the charge point where the session occurred. Only returned for roaming sessions.

cdrIds.description: The CDRs that are generated for roaming sessions.

sessionId.description: The unique id that identifies the charging session in the CPO platform.

roamingOperatorCpoId.description: The id of the roaming operator that owns the charge point at which the session occurred.

cpoLastUpdatedAt.description: Applicable only for OCPI sessions and populated with the most recent shared `last_updated` value from the CPO roaming operator. ISO 8601 formatted date

randomisedDelay.description: Number of seconds by which current offering is being delayed at the start of the session. The field is omitted when randomised delay is not enabled in the Personal Charging settings or when there is no randomised delay.

externalAppData.description: Used to hold any external application data related to the session.

items.description: Session Clock aligned consumption period

start.description: The beginning of the clock-aligned consumption period.

end.description: The end of the clock-aligned consumption period.

energyConsumed.description: The amount of total consumed energy(Wh) during the clock-aligned consumption period.

total.description: The amount of total consumed energy (Wh) during the clock-aligned consumption period.

local.description: The amount of consumed renewable energy (Wh) generated by individual source for the specified clock-aligned consumption period.

grid.description: The amount of consumed energy (Wh) delivered from the grid for the specified clock-aligned consumption period.

totalCost.description: The total cost of energy consumption during the clock-aligned period.

clockAlignedEnergyConsumption.description: Energy consumption during time intervals (15, 30 or 60 minutes) in the charging session. The start of the first interval is the start of the session then the intervals are defined by the exact minute of the hour. Clock-aligned consumption periods are included in the response only when the query param 'withClockAlignedEnergyConsumption' is set to 'true'.

total.description: Delivered energy (Wh)

local.description: The amount of consumed renewable energy (Wh) generated by individual source for all clock-aligned consumption periods in the charging session.

grid.description: The amount of consumed energy (Wh) delivered from the grid for all clock-aligned consumption periods in the charging session.

estimatedSavings.description: The sum of savings that could be achieved if the consumed energy was not locally generated but delivered from the grid for all clock-aligned consumption periods in the charging session.

billingStatus.description: The status of the billing process for the session.

peak.description: The maximum charging power (in watts) reached during the session

average.description: The average charging power (in watts) maintained during the session

parameters.name: X-Signature
parameters.description: SHA256-HMAC signature of the content using the access token

parameters.name: X-Timestamp
parameters.description: ISO-8601 format timestamp including microseconds in Zulu timezone

parameters.description: The tenant ID the notification is associated with

requirePasswordReset.description: Sets a requirement for the user to set a new password when they next open the app. After a new password is set, this option resets automatically.

balance.description: The current amount in the balance of the user (in the base currency). Would not be returned in the response if the user is related to a Partner without "addUserBalance" permission

status.description:
* `enabled` Enabled - the user is allowed to use the system
* `disabled` Disabled - the user is NOT allowed to use the system

externalId.description: Third party identifier of the user

sessionsAllowed.description: Determine the number of sessions a user could start - single or multiple simultaneous sessions, or whether the user could start simultaneous sessions with several Id Tags.

password.description: Returns the hashed password. This property is optional and can be enabled by request.

createdBy.description: The return values are `admin:` , `partner:` - the value after the colon is the respective ID of the admin account or the partner. `token:` - the value after the colon is the admin token. `mobile_api` - means that the User registered themselves through the mobile app.

receiveNewsAndPromotions.description: Shows if the user has opted into receiving news and promotions.

partnerInvites.description: It's a part of the response only if request is called with `include.partnerInvites` query parameter.

items.description: Partner Invite

email.description: Required by default, but if `sendViaEmail` is false, then `email` is null.

language.description: The language of the e-mail sent to the invitee. If none selected, the default end-users language will be used.

bankIban.description: IBAN that is provided for the user.

bankName.description: Name of the Bank for which the user has provided IBAN.

bankCode.description: Bank code assigned by a central bank, a bank supervisory body or a Bankers Association in the country.

bankAccountNumber.description: Bank account ID provided by the user.

bankAccountType.description: Type of account the user has provided.

externalAppData.description:
The externalAppData field is an object designed to hold additional data related to external integrations.
This object can contain the following keys, which are currently supported:

- `externalCustomerId`: A string representing the customer ID of the user in an external payment provider integration. This ID is used to link the user's account within the system to their corresponding account in the external payment provider.

If no information is available, the externalAppData object will be null. It's a part of the response only if request is called with `include.externalAppData` query parameter.

action.description: When the user requests their account to be removed, the action results into "permanently deleted".

post.description:
Partner Changed notification is sent when a partner is created, updated, or deleted.

**Field behavior by action:**
- **created/updated**: Only includes core fields (notification, partnerId, action, lastUpdatedAt)
- **deleted**: Includes core fields plus additional partner details (only non-null fields are included)

When a partner is deleted, identifying fields with non-null values are included in the payload
to enable external systems to clean up their records properly.

companyName.description: The name of the company as per the legal registration (only present for 'deleted' action when value exists)

businessName.description: The operational name of the business if different from company name (only present for 'deleted' action when value exists)

regNo.description: National company registration number (only present for 'deleted' action when value exists)

vatNo.description: The partner's VAT registration number (only present for 'deleted' action when value exists)

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (e.g., DE, BG, US) (only present for 'deleted' action when value exists)

type.description: Setting the type to `charging not allowed` or `free` is enough for creating the particular type of tariff

description.description: Locales that have been created and are not provided on an update will be deleted. Please provide values in all locales that you wish to keep.

additionalInformation.description: Locales that have been created and are not provided on an update will be deleted. Please provide values in all locales that you wish to keep.

learnMoreUrl.description: Locales that have been created and are not provided on an update will be deleted. Please provide values in all locales that you wish to keep.

dayTariffStart.description: A time when the day begins

nightTariffStart.description: A time when the night begins

pricePerSession.description: Price per session. Only applicable with flat rate tariffs. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

connectionFee.description: Connection fee. A fixed fee that is applied at the start of the charging session. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

pricePerKwh.description: Price per kWh. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

dayPricePerKwh.description: Price per kWh during the day. Applicable for duration+energy time of day. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

nightPricePerKwh.description: Price per kWh during the night. Applicable for duration+energy time of day. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

pricePeriodInMinutes.description: Charging period. In minutes. It defines the time-period for charging a fee. Example: If you select 15min then the EV-driver will be charged at the start of every 15min of EV-charging. Applicable for duration+energy and duration+energy time of day

pricePerPeriod.description: Charging fee per period. Applicable for duration+energy. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

durationFeeLimit.description: Duration fee limit for the whole session if fee is applied.

dayPricePerPeriod.description: Charging fee per period during the day. Applicable for duration+energy time of day. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

nightPricePerPeriod.description: Charging fee per period during the night. Applicable for duration+energy time of day. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

dayIdleFeePerMinute.description: Charging fee per minute during the day. Applicable for duration+energy time of day. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

nightIdleFeePerMinute.description: Charging fee per minute during the night. Applicable for duration+energy time of day. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

idleFeePerMinute.description: Idle fee per minute. A fee per minute that is applied during idle period (no charging). Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

idleFeeGracePeriodMinutes.description: Idle fee grace period (min). Optional. When idle period (no charging) is detected during a session the user is given this grace period to remove the vehicle, before idle fee starts applying. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

idlePricingPeriodInMinutes.description: Idle fee per minute. A fee per minute that is applied during idle period (no charging).

idleFeePeriodStart.description: Defined start time for the application of idle fee.

idleFeePeriodEnd.description: Defined end time for the application of idle fee.

idleFeeLimit.description: Idle fee limit for the whole session if fee is applied.

connectionFeeMinimumSessionDuration.description: Connection Fee Minimum Session Duration (min). Optional.

connectionFeeMinimumSessionEnergy.description: Connection Fee Minimum Session Energy (kWh). Optional. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

minPrice.description: Min. price. Sets a minimum total amount per session. This is helpful in the case your payment service provider has a minimum transaction size or high transaction fees and you want to make sure to have a positive ROI per transaction. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

preAuthorizeAmount.description: Pre-authorize amount. The amount to pre-authorize before starting a session. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

taxID.description:
If Multi-tax Support has been enabled in the Ampeco.CHARGE settings, you can provide the taxId for the tariff here. If you do not provide a value or provide `null`, the Default tax will be used.

If Multi-tax Support has not been enabled, any provided value will be ignored.

chargePointElectricityRate.description: Use the Electricity Rate of the Charge Point that is already attached and aims to track the electricity costs.

fallbackElectricityRateId.description: When ChargePointElectricityRate is set to *false*, the Electricity Rate ID MUST be supplied in order the electricity rates for the tariff to be known.

flexibleMarkUpAsFixedPerKwh.description: Set a different fixed markup for different time slots along the day. Applicable for `energy tou` only.

defaultPrice.description: Set price for the intervals not specified in `intervalPricing` field.

intervalPricing.description: The time interval must be always the same and should not exceed the 24-hour mark. It could be either 15 min, 30 min or 60 min. The startAt and endAt must comply with this restriction.

items.description:
A specific price period. The `startsAt` and `endsAt` times should be provided in the local time zone and not in UTC.
Depending on the tenant multi timezone configuration either the tenant timezone will be used, or the timezone specific to the corresponding resource.

startsAt.description: The start time of the period. Formatted as hours:minutes. Should be provided in the local time zone and not in UTC. Uses 24-hour notation.

endsAt.description: The end time of the period. Formatted as hours:minutes. Should be provided in the local time zone and not in UTC. Uses 24-hour notation.

price.description: The price that will apply for the given price period. Must include tax.

multiPricePerKwh.description:
Create the price levels according to the kWh.
The first level must have zero value for **firstKwh**.
The last level must have an infinity value for **lastKwh**.
The **fisrtKwh** value on the current level must be equal to the **lastKwh** value on the previous one.
Instead of using a price per kWh there is the option for a flat fee per level. An example of price levels for kWh is given in the table below. | First kWh | Last kWh | Fee per kWh | Flat Fee | | --------- | ------------| ------------|------------ | | 0 | 5.00 | 0.00 | 2.00 | | 5.00 | 10.00 | 0.35 | 0.00 | | 10.00 | null | 0.40 | 0.00 | Applicable for standard tariff.

multiPricePerDuration.description:
Create the price levels according to the duration of the session from the time the charging started.
The first level must have zero value for **firstUnit**.
The last level must have an infinity value for **lastUnit**.
The **firstUnit** value on the current level must be greater with one unit from the **lastUnit** value on the previous level.
The Unit is created in the **pricePeriodInMinutes** property, the default one is 15 min.
There is the option of applying a flat fee per each level separately.
An example of price levels for duration is given in the table below. | First Unit | Last Unit | Fee per Unit | Flat Fee | | ----------- | ------------| -------------|------------ | | 0 | 8 | 0.50 | 0.00 | | 9 | 24 | 0.55 | 0.00 | | 25 | null | 0.00 | 10.00 | Applicable for standard tariff.

multiIdleFee.description:
Different price levels could be created depending on the duration of the idle period.
The first level must have zero value for **firstUnit**.
The last level must have an infinity value for **lastUnit**.
The **firstUnit** value on the current level must be greater with one unit from the **lastUnit** value on the previous level.
The Unit is created in the **pricePeriodInMinutes** property, the default one is 15 min.
There is the option of applying a flat fee per each level separately.
An example of price levels for idle periods is given in the table below. | First Unit | Last Unit | Fee per Unit | Flat Fee | | ----------- | ------------| -------------|------------ | | 0 | 2 | 0.30 | 0.00 | | 3 | 6 | 0.40 | 0.00 | | 7 | null | 0.00 | 0.00 | Applicable for standard tariff.

regularUsePeriod.description: In minutes. Only for the Peak power level tariff.

startTime.description: The 24-hour format should be used.

endTime.description: The 24-hour format should be used.

idleFeeGracePeriodMinutes.description: Idle fee grace period (min). Optional. When idle period (no charging) is detected during a session the user is given this grace period to remove the vehicle, before idle fee starts applying. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

idlePricingPeriodInMinutes.description: Idle fee per minute. A fee per minute that is applied during idle period (no charging).

connectionFeeMinimumSessionDuration.description: Connection Fee Minimum Session Duration (min). Optional.

connectionFeeMinimumSessionEnergy.description: Connection Fee Minimum Session Energy (kWh). Optional. Up to 5 digits after the decimal point depending on the currency precision.

pricePeriodInMinutes.description: Charging period. In minutes. It defines the time-period for charging a fee. Example: If you select 15min then the EV-driver will be charged at the start of every 15min of EV-charging. Applicable for duration+energy and duration+energy time of day

daysWhenApplied.description: When left empty, this means that this is the standard pricing that would be applied in general without taking into consideration the day.

thresholdPriceForEnergy.description: Price for kWh to be considered by Optimised charging for setting the charging periods.

durationFeeFrom.description: Defined start time for the application of duration fees.

durationFeeTo.description: Defined end time for the application of duration fees.

subsidyIntegrationId.description: The subsidy integration id that should be applied for this tariff. Only valid for Energy ToU tariffs. Please use the AMPECO.CHARGE backend for the specific integration id. Optional.

lockPriceOnSessionStart.description:
When enabled the tariff of the charger will be saved using the pricing interval when the user starts the charging session. This ensures that the price for the user will remain constant for the duration of their session.
Applicable only for:
  - `duration+energy time of day` - it locks duration and energy price components
  - `energy tou` - it locks energy component only

lockEnergyPriceOnSessionStart.description:
When enabled the tariff of the charger will be saved using the pricing interval when the user starts the charging session. This ensures that the price for the user will remain constant for the duration of their session.
Applicable only for `standard_tod tariff`.

lockDurationPriceOnSessionStart.description:
When enabled, the energy fee component of the tariff will be saved using the pricing interval when the user starts the charging session. This ensures that the price for the user will remain constant for the duration of their session.
Applicable only for `standard_tod tariff`.

lockIdlePriceOnSessionStart.description:
When enabled, the duration fee component of the tariff will be saved using the pricing interval when the user starts the charging session. This ensures that the price for the user will remain constant for the whole duration of their session.
Applicable only for `standard_tod tariff`

stateOfChargeIdleThreshold.description:
Switches the session to idle when the SoC (%) exceeds the selected value. Leave empty to use the system wide setting.
This option will take effect only if `Allow custom SoC (%) threshold per Tariff` is set in `Idle period detection` setting.
This only applies to local charge points, it does not affect sessions on roaming charge points. Leave empty to use the system wide setting.

averagePowerIdleThreshold.description:
Sets the session to idle state when the average kW for the past 5 minutes is below the set threshold.
This option will take effect only if `Allow custom power threshold per Tariff` is set in `Idle period detection` setting.

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code

timeLimitMinutes.description: Session max time. The maximum minutes a session is allowed to run. Skip for no time limit.

stopWhenEnergyExceedsKwh.description: The maximum energy (kWh) allowed per session. Skip for no limit.

applyToUsersOfChargePointOwner.description: Makes the tariff apply to users of the partner, who is set as owner of the charge point

applyToUsersOfChargePointPartner.description: Makes the tariff apply to users of the partner, who is set as owner of the charge point

applyToUsersOfAllRoamingEmsps.description: Makes the tariff apply to users of all eMSPs, which are roaming partners

applyToAdHocUsers.description: Makes the tariff valid for non-registered users(ad-hoc charging)

adHocPreAuthorizeAmount.description: Sets the amount that would be blocked on the user's card at the start of the session. Required if applyToAdHocUsers is true and one of the following billing strategies is chosen: `Require payment method and authorize certain amount before starting session` or `Require payment method OR minimum amount in balance`.

adHocStopWhenPreAuthorizedAmountFallsBel.description: Set the minimum pre-authorized amount threshold. When the remaining ad hoc pre-authorized amount falls below this value, the charging session will automatically stop to prevent revenue loss.

applyToUsersOfPartners.description: Users of specific Partners. Provide a list of partner IDs. Matches if the user is a invited to at least one of the partners.

applyToUsersWithGroups.description:
Users with a specific group. Provide a list of user groups. Matches if the user is a member of at least one of the groups. Note: Due to improvements in the user groups, this property could be used with some limitations: 
 1) The value(s) should exactly match the name(s) of the user groups. 
 2) It would not be possible to create a user group from here anymore. 
 3) If there are duplicates, the value would not be accepted.

applyToUserGroupIds.description: An array of user group IDs. Users with a specific group. Provide a list of user group IDs. This restriction applies if the user is a member of at least one of the groups.

applyToUsersWithSubscriptions.description: Users with a specific subscription plan. Provide a list of subscription plan IDs. Matches if the user has active one of the subscription plans.

startDate.description: The date from which the tariff becomes valid.

endDate.description: The expiry date of the tariff. The tariff is valid until this date inclusive.

id.description: The assigned Partner will have access to make changes to the tariff.

defaultPriceInformation.description: The default information that would be shown on the display of the charge point without the user having authorized themselves. The default price information from the base tariff of the first EVSE would be used for the display, when the charge point has more than one EVSE.

defaultPriceInformationOffline.description: The information that would be shown on the display of the charge point when offline.

priceInformation.description: The information that would be shown on the display of the charge point for users that are eligible for this tariff.

totalCostInformation.description: Additional information that would be displayed on the charge point when the session ends, along with the total fees for energy, duration and idle.

integrationId.description: References the internal integration configuration that enables this tariff type

externalId.description: Used to store custom information, usually used for external references or metadata to the resource.

items.description: Authorization

method.description:
The method used to authorize the charging session.
- `user_device` - Authorization via mobile app or web portal
- `id_tag` - Authorization via physical RFID card
- `mac_address` - Authorization via vehicle MAC address (AutoCharge)
- `admin` - Manual authorization by admin user
- `plug_and_charge` - Authorization via Plug & Charge protocol
- `roaming` - Authorization via roaming platform (OCPI/Hubject)
- `payment_terminal` - Authorization via payment terminal
- `plug_and_charge_iso15118` - Authorization via ISO15118 Plug & Charge protocol

source.description:
The origin of the authorization request.
- `local` - Authorization initiated directly on this platform (via mobile app, RFID card, MAC address, admin, or payment terminal)
- `roaming` - Authorization received from a roaming platform (OCPI/Hubject). When source is roaming, method can only be user_device or id_tag.

status.description:
The status of the authorization request.
- `accepted` - Authorization was approved and the user can start charging
- `rejected` - Authorization was denied and the user cannot charge
- `pending` - Authorization is awaiting approval or validation

rejectionReason.description: The reason for rejecting the authorization. Only present when status is rejected.

userId.description: The user that is authorized. For anonymous users this value is 0

idTagUid.description: The UID of the Id Tag that created the authorization. It could be of an RFID card or MAC address.

roaming.description:
Roaming information for authorizations from external EMSPs.
Present only when source is 'roaming'.

Note: The platformRoleId field is conditionally included:
- Always present for OCPI authorizations
- May be absent for Hubject authorizations (only included when hubject_platform_role_id is set)

platformId.description: The roaming platform ID that gave the authorization

platformRoleId.description:
The ID of the roaming operator role (EMSP) that gave the authorization.

Conditional presence:
- OCPI: Always present
- Hubject: Only present when hubject_platform_role_id is set in the authorization

anyOf.title: Create Booking Request Response
anyOf.description: Response schema for create booking request

allOf.title: Create Booking Base
allOf.description: Base properties for create booking request (shared between input and response)

id.description: System-generated unique identifier

type.description: Type of booking request

status.description:
Status of booking request:
- **pending**: Request is awaiting processing
- **approved**: Request has been approved
- **rejected**: Request has been rejected

rejectionReason.description:
Human-readable reason for rejection.

Response behavior: Only present when status is "rejected". Omitted for "pending" and "approved" requests.

type.description: Type of booking request - must be "create"

userId.description: ID of the user for whom the booking is made

locationId.description: ID of the target location

externalId.description:
External identifier from roaming partner (e.g., OCPI request_id).

Response behavior: Only present when an external ID was provided. Omitted when not specified.

evseId.description:
Specific EVSE ID to book.

Response behavior: Only present when a specific EVSE was requested. Omitted when EVSE selection was based on criteria or left to the system.

evseCriteria.description:
Criteria for automatic EVSE selection based on technical requirements. Ignored when evseId is explicitly provided.

Response behavior: Only present when EVSE criteria were specified in the request. Omitted when evseId was provided or no criteria were specified.

allOf.description:
Type of current available on the EVSE:
- **ac**: Alternating Current (AC) charging
- **dc**: Direct Current (DC) fast charging

currentType.description: Required current type (AC or DC). Omitted in response when not specified.

minPower.description: Minimum power requirement in kW. Omitted in response when not specified.

maxPower.description: Maximum power requirement in kW. Omitted in response when not specified.

allOf.description:
Type of connector available on the EVSE:
- **type1**: Type 1 connector (SAE J1772 AC)
- **type2**: Type 2 connector (IEC 62196-2 AC)
- **type3**: Type 3 connector (IEC 62196-2 AC)
- **chademo**: CHAdeMO DC fast charging
- **ccs1**: Combined Charging System 1 (CCS1/Combo 1)
- **ccs2**: Combined Charging System 2 (CCS2/Combo 2)
- **schuko**: Standard European household socket
- **nacs**: North American Charging Standard (Tesla)
- **cee16**: CEE 16A industrial connector
- **cee32**: CEE 32A industrial connector
- **j1772**: SAE J1772 connector
- **inductive**: Inductive/wireless charging
- **nema-5-20**: Domestic M NEMA 5-20 Socket
- **type-e-french**: French Type E socket
- **type-g-british**: British Type G socket
- **type-j-swiss**: Swiss Type J socket
- **avcon**: AVCON connector (Australian standard)
- **gb-t-ac**: GB/T AC connector (Chinese standard)
- **gb-t-dc**: GB/T DC connector (Chinese standard)
- **chaoji**: ChaoJi (CHAdeMO 3.0)
- **nema-6-30**: NEMA 6-30
- **nema-6-50**: NEMA 6-50

connectorType.description: Required connector type. Omitted in response when not specified.

parkingSpaceCriteria.description:
Parking space criteria for selecting EVSE with suitable parking.

Response behavior: This property is only included in the response when parking criteria were specified in the request. If no criteria were provided, this property is omitted entirely.

vehicleWeightKg.description: Vehicle weight in kilograms. Omitted in response when not specified.

vehicleHeightCm.description: Vehicle height in centimeters. Omitted in response when not specified.

vehicleLengthCm.description: Vehicle length in centimeters. Omitted in response when not specified.

vehicleWidthCm.description: Vehicle width in centimeters. Omitted in response when not specified.

allOf.description:
Type of vehicle that can use the parking space:
- **two_and_three_wheel_vehicles_and_quadricycles**: Motorcycles, scooters, and similar
- **passenger_vehicles**: Standard cars
- **passenger_vehicles_with_trailer**: Cars with trailers attached
- **light_duty_vans**: Small commercial vans
- **heavy_duty_tractor_units_without_trailer**: Heavy trucks without trailer
- **heavy_duty_trucks_without_articulation_point**: Heavy trucks without articulation
- **heavy_duty_trucks_with_trailer_attached**: Heavy trucks with trailer
- **buses_or_motor_coaches**: Buses and coaches

vehicleType.description: Required vehicle type. Omitted in response when not specified.

driveThroughRequired.description: Whether parking space must support drive-through charging. Omitted in response when not specified.

refrigerationOutletRequired.description: Whether parking space must have refrigeration outlet. Omitted in response when not specified.

dangerousGoodsAllowed.description: Whether parking space must allow dangerous goods vehicles. Omitted in response when not specified.

id.description: Internal token ID for use in API requests (e.g., authorizedTokenIds in create/update)

uid.description: Unique identifier of the OCPI token

type.description: Type of token (e.g., RFID, APP_USER)

contractId.description: Contract identifier associated with the token (optional)

emspCountryCode.description: Country code of the eMSP (electric Mobility Service Provider) that issued the token

emspPartyId.description: Party identifier of the eMSP (electric Mobility Service Provider) that issued the token

authorizedTokens.description:
Array of OCPI token details authorized for this booking, including eMSP information for roaming scenarios.

Response behavior: Only present when the booking has authorized tokens. Omitted when no tokens are associated with the booking.

bookingId.description:
ID of the created booking.

Response behavior: Only present when status is "approved". Omitted for "pending" and "rejected" requests.

status.description:
Status of booking:
- **accepted**: Booking has been approved and confirmed
- **reserved**: EVSE has been reserved via OCPP ReserveNow command
- **completed**: User has started a charging session and fulfilled the booking
- **cancelled**: Booking has been cancelled by user or system
- **no-show**: User failed to start session within the no-show timeout period
- **failed**: System failed to reserve the EVSE after multiple attempts

sessionId.description: ID of the charging session that fulfilled the booking

accessMethods.description:
Physical access methods copied from the location at booking creation time. This snapshot preserves the access methods that were available when the booking was made, even if the location's access methods change later.

**Response behavior (GET):**
- Field is omitted from the response when no access methods were configured at the location during booking creation (null in database)
- When access methods were configured but the array was empty, returns an empty array `[]`

first.description: The URL to fetch the first page

last.description: The URL to fetch the last page

prev.description: The URL to fetch the previous page

next.description: The URL to fetch the next page. Use this link always in order to utilize the cursor pagination

path.description: The base route of the endpoint (unpaginated)

per_page.description: The max number of items in each page

next_cursor.description: The cursor to fetch the next page. Do not use this directly. It will be populated by using the previous response's links.next.

prev_cursor.description: The cursor to fetch the previous page. Do not use this directly. It will be populated by using the previous response's links.prev.

startDateTimeFrom.description: Filters CDRs by the start time, selecting records with a start time equal to or later than the specified value. The date-time should be formatted according to ISO 8601 standards.

startDateTimeTo.description: Filters CDRs by the start time, selecting records with a start time equal to or earlier than the specified value. This filter helps in selecting records up to a certain start time. The provided date-time should be in ISO 8601 format.

endDateTimeFrom.description: This filter retrieves CDRs with an end time equal to or later than the specified value. It helps filter records based on the end of a timeframe, ensuring that only records ending after a certain point are selected. The date-time format should adhere to ISO 8601 standards.

endDateTimeTo.description: Filters CDRs based on their end time, selecting those with an end time equal to or earlier than the provided value. This filter limits the selection to records that conclude by a certain time. The date-time should be in ISO 8601 format.

operatorId.description: Only CDRs associated with a specific Roaming Operator/Provider.

platformId.description: Only CDRs linked to a specific Roaming Platform.

roamingId.description: Filters CDRs by the unique identifier within the CPO's platform (and sub-operator platforms).

isLocal.description: If true only CDRs that we issued as CPO will be returned, if false only CDRs that we received as eMSP will be returned.

receivedAfter.description: Filters CDRs by the time when received from CPOs, selecting records with a received time equal to or later than the specified value. This filter helps in selecting received records from a certain time and works for non local CDRs. The provided date-time should be following the ISO 8601 standard.

receivedBefore.description: Filters CDRs by the time when received from CPOs, selecting records with a start time equal to or earlier than the specified value. This filter helps in selecting received records up to a certain time and works for non local CDRs. The provided date-time should be following the ISO 8601 standard.

sentAfter.description: Filters CDRs by the time when sent to EMSP, selecting records with a sent time equal to or later than the specified value. This filter helps in selecting sent records from a certain time and works for local CDRs. The provided date-time should be following the ISO 8601 standard.

sentBefore.description: Filters CDRs by the time when sent to EMSP, selecting records with a sent time equal to or earlier than the specified value. This filter helps in selecting sent records from a certain time and works for local CDRs. The provided date-time should be following the ISO 8601 standard.

deliveryResponse.description:
Filters CDRs that were sent to the EMSP based on their delivery status.
Use this dropdown filter to retrieve CDRs with one of the following statuses:
  - `success`: CDRs successfully **accepted** by the EMSP.
  - `fail`: CDRs that were **rejected** (not accepted) by the EMSP.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Include additional information in the response. The following options are available:
- `externalAppData`: Include external application data in the response

sessionId.description: Unique ID of the session for which this CDR is sent.

startTime.description: Start timestamp of the charging session, or in-case of a reservation (before the start of a session) the start of the reservation.

endTime.description: The timestamp when the session was completed/finished, charging might have finished before the session ends, for example - EV is full, but parking cost also has to be paid.

ocpiData.description: When the CDR is based on the OCPI protocols. The field descriptions follow the specifications in the different protocols (OCPI 2.1.1, OCPI 2.2). As the data is served in the API without any, based on the protocol validation, the response can contain differences compared to the protocol description.

signedData.description: Signed data that belongs to this charging Session. Omitted if protocol differs from OCPI 2.2 or object is empty.

cdrToken.description: Token used to start this charging session, includes all the relevant information to identify the unique token. Omitted if protocol differs from OCPI 2.2.

authorizationReference.description: Reference to the authorization given by the eMSP. Omitted if protocol differs from OCPI 2.2 or OCPI 2.1.1 Gireve

cdrLocation.description: Location where the charging session took place, including only the relevant EVSE and Connector. The properties in the object differ according to the version and source of protocol OCPI 2.1.1, OCPI 2.2

chargingPeriods.description: List of Charging Periods that make up this charging session. A session consists of 1 or more periods, where each period has a different relevant Tariff. The properties in the object differ according to the version and source of protocol (OCPI 2.1.1 or OCPI 2.2)

currency.description: ISO 4217 code of the currency used for this session.

totalCost.description: The total cost excl VAT of the session in the specified currency.

totalFixedCost.description: Total sum excl VAT of all the fixed costs in the specified currency, except fixed price components of parking and reservation.

totalEnergyCost.description: Total sum excl VAT of all the cost of all the energy used, in the specified currency.

totalTime.description: Total duration of the charging session (including the duration of charging and not charging), in hours.

totalTimeCost.description: Total sum of all the cost related to duration of charging during this transaction, in the specified currency.

totalParkingTime.description: Total duration of the charging session where the EV was not charging (no energy was transferred between EVSE and EV), in hours.

totalParkingCost.description: Total sum excl VAT of all the cost related to parking of this transaction, including fixed price components, in the specified currency.

invoiceReferenceId.description: This field can be used to reference an invoice, that will later be send for this CDR.

oicpData.description: When the CDR is based on the OICP protocols. The field descriptions follow the specifications in the different protocols (Hubject 2.2, Hubject 2.3). As the data is served in the API without any, based on the protocol validation, the response can contain differences compared to the protocol description.

identification.description: Authentication data details. The data structure differs depending on the authentication technology

chargingStart.description: The date and time at which the charging process started. The field is required in version 2.3 and optional in version 2.2

chargingEnd.description: The date and time at which the charging process stopped. The field is required in version 2.3 and optional in version 2.2.

consumedEnergy.description: The difference between MeterValueEnd and MeterValueStart in kWh. The field is required in version 2.3 and optional in version 2.2.

signedMeteringValues.description: Omitted if protocol differs from version 2.3

meteringSignature.description: Omitted if protocol differs from version 2.2

calibrationLawVerificationInfo.description: Omitted if protocol differs from version 2.3

roamingId.description: Uniquely identifies the CDR within the CPOâs platform (and sub operator platforms).

credit.description: Indicates whether it is a credit CDR.

isLocal.description: True indicates that we issued the CDR in the role of CPO, false indicates that we received the CDR as an eMSP.

deliveryResponse.description: Status of the response from the EMSP. Presented only for local CDRs.

externalAppData.description: Used to hold any external application data related to the CDR.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Include additional information in the response. The following options are available:
- `externalAppData`: Include external application data in the response

sessionId.description: Unique ID of the session for which this CDR is sent.

startTime.description: Start timestamp of the charging session, or in-case of a reservation (before the start of a session) the start of the reservation.

endTime.description: The timestamp when the session was completed/finished, charging might have finished before the session ends, for example - EV is full, but parking cost also has to be paid.

ocpiData.description: When the CDR is based on the OCPI protocols. The field descriptions follow the specifications in the different protocols (OCPI 2.1.1, OCPI 2.2). As the data is served in the API without any, based on the protocol validation, the response can contain differences compared to the protocol description.

signedData.description: Signed data that belongs to this charging Session. Omitted if protocol differs from OCPI 2.2 or object is empty.

cdrToken.description: Token used to start this charging session, includes all the relevant information to identify the unique token. Omitted if protocol differs from OCPI 2.2.

authorizationReference.description: Reference to the authorization given by the eMSP. Omitted if protocol differs from OCPI 2.2 or OCPI 2.1.1 Gireve

cdrLocation.description: Location where the charging session took place, including only the relevant EVSE and Connector. The properties in the object differ according to the version and source of protocol OCPI 2.1.1, OCPI 2.2

chargingPeriods.description: List of Charging Periods that make up this charging session. A session consists of 1 or more periods, where each period has a different relevant Tariff. The properties in the object differ according to the version and source of protocol (OCPI 2.1.1 or OCPI 2.2)

currency.description: ISO 4217 code of the currency used for this session.

totalCost.description: The total cost excl VAT of the session in the specified currency.

totalFixedCost.description: Total sum excl VAT of all the fixed costs in the specified currency, except fixed price components of parking and reservation.

totalEnergyCost.description: Total sum excl VAT of all the cost of all the energy used, in the specified currency.

totalTime.description: Total duration of the charging session (including the duration of charging and not charging), in hours.

totalTimeCost.description: Total sum of all the cost related to duration of charging during this transaction, in the specified currency.

totalParkingTime.description: Total duration of the charging session where the EV was not charging (no energy was transferred between EVSE and EV), in hours.

totalParkingCost.description: Total sum excl VAT of all the cost related to parking of this transaction, including fixed price components, in the specified currency.

invoiceReferenceId.description: This field can be used to reference an invoice, that will later be send for this CDR.

oicpData.description: When the CDR is based on the OICP protocols. The field descriptions follow the specifications in the different protocols (Hubject 2.2, Hubject 2.3). As the data is served in the API without any, based on the protocol validation, the response can contain differences compared to the protocol description.

chargingEnd.description: The date and time at which the charging process stopped. The field is required in version 2.3 and optional in version 2.2.

consumedEnergy.description: The difference between MeterValueEnd and MeterValueStart in kWh. The field is required in version 2.3 and optional in version 2.2.

signedMeteringValues.description: Omitted if protocol differs from version 2.3

meteringSignature.description: Omitted if protocol differs from version 2.2

calibrationLawVerificationInfo.description: Omitted if protocol differs from version 2.3

get.description: Get all Charge Point Downtime Periods

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The numbers of items to return

startedAfter.description: ISO 8601 formatted date. Resources with `startedAt >= startedAfter`.

stoppedBefore.description: ISO 8601 formatted date. Resources with `stoppedAt <= stoppedBefore`.

durationLessThan.description: Resources with duration in minutes less than or equal given value.

durationGreaterThan.description: Resources with duration in minutes greater than or equal given value.

lastUpdatedAfter.description: ISO 8601 formatted date. Lists only the specific resource that was last updated on and after this datetime

lastUpdatedBefore.description: ISO 8601 formatted date. Lists only the specific resource that was last updated on and before this datetime

chargePointId.description: Id of the charge point for which the downtime period is recorded.

startedAt.description: ISO 8601 formatted date. The time at which the charge point changed its status to meet the requirements for entering a downtime period.

endedAt.description: ISO 8601 formatted date. The time at which the charge point changed its status to meet the requirements for exiting the downtime period.

locationId.description: Id of associated location.

entryMode.description:
* `manual` - created by an admin
* `automatic` - created automatically by the system.

noticeId.description: Id of the predefined notices from Downtime Period Notice Resource

system.description:
Shows the system status of the Charge Point.
  * `enabled` - the charge point is fully operative.
  * `disabled` - the charge point would not be shown on the map if it is a commercial public or commercial private with the relevant option for visibility nor could be claimed or found by ID if it is personal (home). </br>
  * `demo` - acts as a simulator so different setups could be tested.
  * `out of order` - the charge point is visible and shared with users, but a charging session

network.description:
Connection status of the charge point:
  * `never connected` - the charge point has not yet connected to the CPMS
  * `available` - connected to the CPMS
  * `temporarily unavailable` - disconnected a short while ago
  * `long-term unavailable` - disconnected, and some time has passed, so we dont expect the connection will be restores

hardware.description:
Status reported by the charge point's EVSE:
 * `available` - When a Connector becomes available for a new user (Operative)
 * `preparing` - When a Connector becomes no longer available for a new user but there is no ongoing Transaction (yet). Typically a Connector is in preparing state when a user presents a tag, inserts a cable or a vehicle occupies the parking bay (Operative)
 * `charging` - When the contactor of a Connector closes, allowing the vehicle to charge (Operative)
 * `suspendedEVSE` - When the EV is connected to the EVSE but the EVSE is not offering energy to the EV, e.g. due to a smart charging restriction, local supply power constraints. (Operative)
 * `suspendedEV` - When the EV is connected to the EVSE and the EVSE is offering energy but the EV is not taking any energy. For example the driver has unlocked the car, and the car has paused charging. (Operative)
 * `finishing` - When a Transaction has stopped at a Connector, but the Connector is not yet available for a new user, e.g. the cable has not been removed or the vehicle has not left the parking bay (Operative)
 * `reserved` - When a EVSE becomes reserved as a result of a Reserve Now command (Operative)
 * `unavailable` - When a EVSE becomes unavailable as the result of a Change Availability command or an event upon which the Charge Point transitions to unavailable at its discretion. Upon receipt of a Change Availability command, the status MAY change immediately or the change MAY be scheduled. When scheduled, the Status Notification shall be send when the availability change becomes effective (Inoperative)
 * `faulted` - When a Charge Point or connector has reported an error and is not available for energy delivery (Inoperative)

When hardware status is null, that means that the charge point has not connected yet or has not reported a hardware status for this evse in the past

statuses.description: A snapshot of the statuses of the charge point at the time of creation of the downtime period.

evseId.description: Only list charge point on a certain EVSE

evsePhysicalReference.description: Only list charge point on a certain EVSE, identified by the physicalReference

physicalReference.description: Only list charge point, identified by id

chargePointNetworkId.description: Only list charge point, identified by the NetworkId

chargePointBootNotificationSerialNumber.description: Only list charge points with last boot notification that had this charge_point_serial_number

userId.description: Only list charge points owned by a certain user

partnerId.description: Only list charge points owned by a certain partner

accessType.description: Only list charge points with this access type

subOperatorId.description: Only list charge point for a given subOperator

roaming.description: When true - returns only roaming charge points. When false - returns only local charge points.

name.description: Exact charge point name

locationId.description: Only list charge points assigned to the location

managedByOperator.description: Only list charge points that are managed by operator or not

externalId.description: Only list charge point, identified by the External ID of the charge point

evseExternalId.description: Only list charge point, identified by the External ID of the EVSE

tag.description: Only list charge points that have the specific tag assigned.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to fetch (defaults to 1). Not used in cursor pagination.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The numbers of items to return. Used in both page and cursor pagination to declare the page size.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to fetch the next page. Set it to empty in order to engage the cursor pagination that has more performance but requires you to get each pages response before you can move on to the next page. for example `?cursor`

roaming.description: If the evse was received from a roaming CPO, this object will contain the details

evseId.description: The EVSE Id that we receive through roaming

tariffIds.description: The tariffs IDS that we received from roaming (as were specified by the CPO)

capabilities.description: The evse capabilities defined by the CPO

status.description: * `available` - The EVSE/Connector is able to start a new charging session. * `blocked` - The EVSE/Connector is not accessible because of a physical barrier, i.e. a car. * `charging` - The EVSE/Connector is in use. * `inoperative` - The EVSE/Connector is not yet active or it is no longer available (deleted). * `outoforder` - The EVSE/Connector is currently out of order. * `planned` - The EVSE/Connector is planned, will be operating soon. * `removed` - The EVSE/Connector/charge point is discontinued/removed. * `reserved` - The EVSE/Connector is reserved for a particular EV driver and is unavailable for other drivers. * `unknown` -  No status information available. (Also used when offline)

networkId.description: The OCPP evse identidier (should be consecutive numbers starting from 1)

physicalReference.description: The identifier that is presented to the user, so he can identify the EVSE at the location

currentType.description:
Type of current available on the EVSE:
- **ac**: Alternating Current (AC) charging
- **dc**: Direct Current (DC) fast charging

maxVoltage.description:
The maxVoltage of a CP can fluctuate. Hence, when creating a CP in Ampeco system the maxVoltage is given as a range. For OCPI purposes it maps as follows:
 * `220-240` = 230
 * `110-130` = 120
 * `400` = 400
 * `380` = 380

type.description:
Type of connector available on the EVSE:
- **type1**: Type 1 connector (SAE J1772 AC)
- **type2**: Type 2 connector (IEC 62196-2 AC)
- **type3**: Type 3 connector (IEC 62196-2 AC)
- **chademo**: CHAdeMO DC fast charging
- **ccs1**: Combined Charging System 1 (CCS1/Combo 1)
- **ccs2**: Combined Charging System 2 (CCS2/Combo 2)
- **catarc**: CATARC connector (Chinese standard)
- **schuko**: Standard European household socket
- **nacs**: North American Charging Standard (Tesla)
- **cee16**: CEE 16A industrial connector
- **cee32**: CEE 32A industrial connector
- **j1772**: SAE J1772 connector
- **inductive**: Inductive/wireless charging
- **nema-5-20**: Domestic M NEMA 5-20 Socket
- **type-e-french**: French Type E socket
- **type-g-british**: British Type G socket
- **type-j-swiss**: Swiss Type J socket
- **avcon**: AVCON connector (Australian standard)
- **chaoji**: ChaoJi (CHAdeMO 3.0)
- **nema-6-30**: NEMA 6-30
- **nema-6-50**: NEMA 6-50

midMeterCertificationEndYear.description: The mid meter certification end year.

tariffGroupId.description: The id of the tariff group associated with the evse

allowsReservation.description: are reservations allowed on this EVSE

hardwareStatus.description:
Status reported by the charge point's EVSE:
 * `available` - When a Connector becomes available for a new user (Operative)
 * `preparing` - When a Connector becomes no longer available for a new user but there is no ongoing Transaction (yet). Typically a Connector is in preparing state when a user presents a tag, inserts a cable or a vehicle occupies the parking bay (Operative)
 * `charging` - When the contactor of a Connector closes, allowing the vehicle to charge (Operative)
 * `suspendedEVSE` - When the EV is connected to the EVSE but the EVSE is not offering energy to the EV, e.g. due to a smart charging restriction, local supply power constraints. (Operative)
 * `suspendedEV` - When the EV is connected to the EVSE and the EVSE is offering energy but the EV is not taking any energy. For example the driver has unlocked the car, and the car has paused charging. (Operative)
 * `finishing` - When a Transaction has stopped at a Connector, but the Connector is not yet available for a new user, e.g. the cable has not been removed or the vehicle has not left the parking bay (Operative)
 * `reserved` - When a EVSE becomes reserved as a result of a Reserve Now command (Operative)
 * `unavailable` - When a EVSE becomes unavailable as the result of a Change Availability command or an event upon which the Charge Point transitions to unavailable at its discretion. Upon receipt of a Change Availability command, the status MAY change immediately or the change MAY be scheduled. When scheduled, the Status Notification shall be send when the availability change becomes effective (Inoperative)
 * `faulted` - When a Charge Point or connector has reported an error and is not available for energy delivery (Inoperative)

When hardware status is null, that means that the charge point has not connected yet or has not reported a hardware status for this evse in the past

showToPublicWithNotice.description: Only available if the ChargePoint has private access

notice.description: The notice is only available if showToPublicWithNotice is set to "true"

currentSecurityProfile.description: The security profile that is currenty being used by the charge point. Description of the supported security profiles can be found in the security whitepaper available here - https://www.openchargealliance.org/protocols/ocpp-16/

hardwareEnabledSecurityProfile.description: The maximum security profile that the charge point hardware supports. Description of the supported security profiles can be found in the security whitepaper available here - https://www.openchargealliance.org/protocols/ocpp-16/

desiredSecurityProfileStatus.description: Whether the last requested desiredSecurityProfile was successfully applied to the charge point

roamingOperatorId.description: When null the charge point is a local one. For roaming charge points, the ID of the roaming operator is provided

autoFaultRecovery.description: By enabling this, the charge point will attempt to automatically recover from the faulted state and resume normal operations.

externalId.description: The field should have unique value

vendorErrorCode.description: This property is shown only when the hardwareStatus is faulted.

tags.description: Tags can be used for filtering and grouping chargers by tag. When doing a PATCH input all tags that should be associated with the charge point. Omitting a tag would remove it from the charge point.

uptimeTrackingEnabled.description:
Indicates whether Uptime tracking is currently enabled for the charge point.

**Examples:**
- `true` - Uptime tracking is enabled (open operational period exists)
- `false` - Uptime tracking is disabled (no open operational period)

uptimeTrackingActivatedAt.description:
The timestamp when Uptime tracking was activated (start of current open operational period).
Omitted from response if Uptime tracking is not enabled or has never been activated.
Format: ISO 8601 with timezone offset.

**Example:**
`"2025-10-14T08:30:00+00:00"` - When uptime tracking is enabled

**Note:** This field is omitted from the response when uptime tracking is disabled or never activated.

networkId.description: OCPP Identifier

plugAndCharge.description: Enable this flag if you the CP is configured in plug and charge mode, it automatically starts a session when a car is plugged in, and the ID tag should not be authorized

locationId.description: locationId is always a REQUIRED field for commercial public and commercial private charge points. It is NOT a required field only for personal charge points.

pin.description: pin is always a REQUIRED field for personal charge points. It is NOT a required field for commercial public and commercial private charge points.

desiredSecurityProfile.description: The security profile that the backend will try to force the charge point to use for connecting to the backend. Description of the supported security profiles can be found in the security whitepaper available here - https://www.openchargealliance.org/protocols/ocpp-16/

partnerCorporateBillingAsDefault.description: For users who have corporate billing with the same Partner as the Partner assigned to the charge point, the default payment method on this charge point will be the respective corporate billing account of the Partner.

partnerAccessType.description: Applicable only to Commercial Private charge points. Further defines the access type and visibility of the charge point.

tags.description: Tags can be used for filtering and grouping chargers by tag. When doing a PATCH input all tags that should be associated with the charge point. Omitting a tag would remove it from the charge point.

networkStatus.description:
Connection status of the charge point:
  * `never connected` - the charge point has not yet connected to the CPMS
  * `available` - connected to the CPMS
  * `temporarily unavailable` - disconnected a short while ago
  * `long-term unavailable` - disconnected, and some time has passed, so we dont expect the connection will be restores

hardwareStatus.description: When hardware status is null, that means that the charge point has not connected yet or has not reported a hardware status for the charge point in the past

first.description: The URL to fetch the first page

last.description: The URL to fetch the last page

prev.description: The URL to fetch the previous page

next.description: The URL to fetch the next page. Use this link always in order to utilize the cursor pagination

anyOf.title: Basic Pagination
anyOf.description:
In case of basic pagination, the meta object will contain the following properties.

This type of pagination is being deprecated. Only use it if cursor pagination is not available for the resource.

current_page.description: The number of the current page being fetched

from.description: The first of the fetched item's position in the total list

last_page.description: The number of the past page

links.description: Array of link objects pointing to the previous/current/next pages

url.description: The URL to the previous/current/next page or null if such page does not exist

label.description: The name of the page that the links should be pointing to

active.description: Is the link active, it will be true only when there is an URL

path.description: The base route of the endpoint (unpaginated)

per_page.description: The max number of items in each page

to.description: The last of the fetched item's position in the total list

total.description: The total number of items in the list

anyOf.title: Cursor Pagination
anyOf.description: In case of cursor pagination, the meta object will contain the following properties

path.description: The base route of the endpoint (unpaginated)

per_page.description: The max number of items in each page

next_cursor.description: The cursor to fetch the next page. Do not use this directly. It will be populated by using the previous response's links.next.

prev_cursor.description: The cursor to fetch the previous page. Do not use this directly. It will be populated by using the previous response's links.prev.

status.description: * `available` - The EVSE/Connector is able to start a new charging session. * `blocked` - The EVSE/Connector is not accessible because of a physical barrier, i.e. a car. * `charging` - The EVSE/Connector is in use. * `inoperative` - The EVSE/Connector is not yet active or it is no longer available (deleted). * `outoforder` - The EVSE/Connector is currently out of order. * `planned` - The EVSE/Connector is planned, will be operating soon. * `removed` - The EVSE/Connector/charge point is discontinued/removed. * `reserved` - The EVSE/Connector is reserved for a particular EV driver and is unavailable for other drivers. * `unknown` -  No status information available. (Also used when offline)

networkId.description: The OCPP evse identidier (should be consecutive numbers starting from 1)

physicalReference.description: The identifier that is presented to the user, so he can identify the EVSE at the location

currentType.description:
Type of current available on the EVSE:
- **ac**: Alternating Current (AC) charging
- **dc**: Direct Current (DC) fast charging

maxVoltage.description:
The maxVoltage of a CP can fluctuate. Hence, when creating a CP in Ampeco system the maxVoltage is given as a range. For OCPI purposes it maps as follows:
 * `220-240` = 230
 * `110-130` = 120
 * `400` = 400
 * `380` = 380

hardwareStatus.description:
Status reported by the charge point's EVSE:
 * `available` - When a Connector becomes available for a new user (Operative)
 * `preparing` - When a Connector becomes no longer available for a new user but there is no ongoing Transaction (yet). Typically a Connector is in preparing state when a user presents a tag, inserts a cable or a vehicle occupies the parking bay (Operative)
 * `charging` - When the contactor of a Connector closes, allowing the vehicle to charge (Operative)
 * `suspendedEVSE` - When the EV is connected to the EVSE but the EVSE is not offering energy to the EV, e.g. due to a smart charging restriction, local supply power constraints. (Operative)
 * `suspendedEV` - When the EV is connected to the EVSE and the EVSE is offering energy but the EV is not taking any energy. For example the driver has unlocked the car, and the car has paused charging. (Operative)
 * `finishing` - When a Transaction has stopped at a Connector, but the Connector is not yet available for a new user, e.g. the cable has not been removed or the vehicle has not left the parking bay (Operative)
 * `reserved` - When a EVSE becomes reserved as a result of a Reserve Now command (Operative)
 * `unavailable` - When a EVSE becomes unavailable as the result of a Change Availability command or an event upon which the Charge Point transitions to unavailable at its discretion. Upon receipt of a Change Availability command, the status MAY change immediately or the change MAY be scheduled. When scheduled, the Status Notification shall be send when the availability change becomes effective (Inoperative)
 * `faulted` - When a Charge Point or connector has reported an error and is not available for energy delivery (Inoperative)

When hardware status is null, that means that the charge point has not connected yet or has not reported a hardware status for this evse in the past
